intro: Vincetoxicum oligophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Europe. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Vincetoxicum oligophyllum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and flowers.
